meanings.definition: To leap or jump farther or higher than someone or something else.
meanings.sent1: The rabbit tried to outleap the turtle in the race.
meanings.sent2: The athlete managed to outleap all his competitors in the long jump.
meanings.sent3: The frog thought it could outleap the kangaroo, but soon realized it was a silly idea.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to outleap her fears propelled her to new heights.
meanings.sent5: With a mighty effort, he prepared to outleap the obstacle in his path.

meanings.definition: To surpass in leaping or jumping.
meanings.sent1: The gazelle can outleap any predator in the savanna.
meanings.sent2: The young gymnast trained hard to outleap her previous record.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to outleap the cat, but ended up in a comical chase around the tree.
meanings.sent4: Her joy seemed to outleap the bounds of possibility.
meanings.sent5: The dancer's graceful movements seemed to outleap the laws of physics.
